title: CRISPR spacer/DNA-binding recognition motif
description: This feature detects specific DNA sequence motifs that are common to CRISPR spacer elements and certain DNA-binding protein recognition sites. The feature activates with sharp, distinct spikes precisely at CRISPR spacer locations when present (examples 2, 4). In the absence of CRISPR elements, it activates near DNA-binding regulatory proteins such as helix-turn-helix domain proteins, transcription factors, and DNA gyrase. This suggests the feature recognizes a specific nucleotide pattern or structural motif shared between CRISPR spacers and regulatory protein binding sites. The pattern is highly consistent across diverse bacterial species including Firmicutes, Proteobacteria, and high G+C Gram-positive bacteria, indicating an evolutionarily conserved sequence element important for DNA-protein interactions in both CRISPR-mediated immunity and transcriptional regulation.
